class.name: Word.CustomXmlPartScopedCollection
class.description: Contains the collection of [Word.CustomXmlPart](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.customxmlpart) objects with a specific namespace.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Gets the loaded child items in this collection.

methods.name: getCount
methods.description: Gets the number of items in the collection.

methods.name: getItem
methods.description: Gets a custom XML part based on its ID.

params.name: id
params.description: ID of the custom XML part to be retrieved.

methods.name: getItemOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets a custom XML part based on its ID. If the CustomXmlPart doesn't exist in the collection, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see [*OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

params.name: id
params.description: Required. ID of the object to be retrieved.

methods.name: getOnlyItem
methods.description: If the collection contains exactly one item, this method returns it. Otherwise, this method produces an error.

methods.name: getOnlyItemOrNullObject
methods.description: If the collection contains exactly one item, this method returns it. Otherwise, this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see [*OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.CustomXmlPartScopedCollection object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.CustomXmlPartScopedCollectionData) that contains an "items" array with shallow copies of any loaded properties from the collection's items.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.
